* Fix a structure <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A}</math> and an assignment function <math display="inline">s : Vars \to A</math>. We have to show: <math display="block">\mathfrak{A} \models \left( \left[ \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land  \dotsb \land \left( x_n= y_n \right)   \right] \to  \left( f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right) = f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right)  \right)  \right) \left[ s \right]</math>
* TODO - Proofs of the other axioms.
----

====== Aside:  ======
* Since the is an implication of the form <math display="inline">\psi \to  \lambda</math> one may assume <math display="inline">\psi</math>, another way to see that is by looking at the equivalence to <math display="inline">\neg \psi \lor \lambda</math>, since if <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \left( \neg \psi  \right)\left[ s \right]</math>
** In other words if <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \not \models \psi\left[ s \right]</math>, then we would already know that <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A}  \models \left( \psi \lor \lambda  \right)\left[ s \right]</math>, therefore one may assume that <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \psi\left[ s \right]</math> and then show that <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \lambda\left[ s \right]</math>.
----

* In our case, we assume that <math display="inline">\mathfrak{A} \models \left[ \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land  \dotsb \land \left( x_n= y_n \right)   \right]\left[ s \right]</math>, now we must show that <math display="block">\mathfrak{A} \models \left( f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right) = f\left(y_{1}, y_{2},  \dots ,y_{n - 1},y_{n} \right)  \right) \left[ s \right]</math>
** Recall from the second clause of the definition of satisfaction, one must show that <math display="block">\bar{s} \left(f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right) \right) = \bar{s} \left(f\left(y_{1}, y_{2},  \dots ,y_{n - 1},y_{n} \right) \right)</math>, but that <math display="inline">\bar{s} \left(f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right) \right) = f\left(\bar{s} \left(x_{1} \right) , \bar{s} \left(x_{2} \right) , \bar{s} \left(x_{3} \right) , \ldots, \bar{s} \left(x_{n} \right)  \right)</math> and also <math display="inline">\bar{s} \left(f\left(y_{1}, y_{2},  \dots ,y_{n - 1},y_{n} \right) \right) = f\left(\bar{s} \left(y_{1} \right) , \bar{s} \left(y_{2} \right) , \bar{s} \left(y_{3} \right) , \ldots, \bar{s} \left(y_{n} \right) \right)</math>
** From our assumption, we know that <math>\mathfrak{A} \models \left[ \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land  \dotsb \land \left( x_n= y_n \right)   \right]\left[ s \right] </math> is true, and so we have <math display="block">\bar{s} \left(x_{1} \right) = \bar{s} \left(y_{1} \right), \bar{s} \left(x_{2} \right) = \bar{s} \left(y_{2} \right), \bar{s} \left(x_{3} \right) = \bar{s} \left(y_{3} \right) , \ldots, \bar{s} \left(x_{n} \right) = \bar{s} \left(y_{n} \right)        </math>
** Because of this we can see that <math>f\left(\bar{s} \left(x_{1} \right) , \bar{s} \left(x_{2} \right) , \bar{s} \left(x_{3} \right) , \ldots, \bar{s} \left(x_{n} \right)  \right) =  f\left(\bar{s} \left(y_{1} \right) , \bar{s} \left(y_{2} \right) , \bar{s} \left(y_{3} \right) , \ldots, \bar{s} \left(y_{n} \right) \right) </math>, and so we have that: <math display="block">\mathfrak{A} \models \left( \left[ \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land \left( x_1= y_1 \right) \land  \dotsb \land \left( x_n= y_n \right)   \right] \to  \left( f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right) = f\left(x_{1}, x_{2},  \dots ,x_{n - 1},x_{n} \right)  \right)  \right) \left[ s \right]</math>
